CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 5, 1957, pg. A17, reads: "Mrs. and Mrs. Herbert Clark Willis...Teenie Harris photo."  Portion of accompanying article reads: "Helen Irene Luck Exchanges Vows With Herbert Willis.  In beautiful candlelight rites Miss Helen Irene Luck exchanged marriage vows with Herbert Clark Willis in a double-ring ceremony at Mount Ararat Baptist Church.  Rev. Clarence A. Burrell officiated.  The couple left on a wedding trip to Canada after a reception at Loendi Club.  The bride is the daughter of Mrs. Helen Irene Luck and the late Marcellus Luck of Mount Vernon St.  The bridegroom is the sone of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Willis.  The bride's ballerina-length gown was of white Italian dupiono silk, fashioned in princess lines with long fitted sleeves and the skirt accented by a bouffant flounce.  She carried a white Bible with white orchids surrounded with stephanotis and pom poms.  The matron of honor, Mrs. Edna Wallace, and the bridesmaids, Mrs. Corine Luck, sister-in-law of the bride, and Mrs. Elva Mae Fredericks, wore embroidered peau de soi ballerina-length gowns.  Each bore bandeaux of flower leaves and carried a lighted candle encircled with carnations.  Patrice King was flower girl.  Craig Hayward, the bridegroom's nephew, was the ringbearer.  James Moore was best man.  Ushers were Paul Willis, brother of the bridegroom, and Oliver Luck, brother of the bride..."
TitMainTitle: Bride Helen Irene Luck Willis posed in Mount Ararat Baptist Church
